meanings.definition: A shortened version of a written work.
meanings.sent1: I prefer reading abridgments because they are shorter and easier to understand.
meanings.sent2: The library had many abridgments of classic novels for students to borrow.
meanings.sent3: The teacher joked that the abridgments of the textbooks were so short, they only had one page.
meanings.sent4: Her summary of the movie was like an abridgment, capturing the main points in just a few sentences.
meanings.sent5: The abridgment of the play made it more accessible to a wider audience.

meanings.definition: The act of shortening a written work.
meanings.sent1: The abridgments of the articles saved space in the magazine.
meanings.sent2: His job involved the abridgments of legal documents to make them more concise.
meanings.sent3: The abridgments of the novels were so extreme that they left out important details.
meanings.sent4: The abridgments of the speeches made them more impactful and to the point.
meanings.sent5: The abridgments of the stories made them perfect for bedtime reading.
